<url>http://www.lsoft.com/images/listserv_small.gif</url> </image>   <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;79219894.1503">   <title>Re: Session proposal: "teaching post-socialist urbanism(s)" (and a sort of open call to CAT members to participate) </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;79219894.1503</link>   <description> Dear Oleg,<br><br>These are interesting questions. My take on teaching Urbanism as a<br>discipline can be summarised as follows:<br>1) all cities functioning in a market economy face similar challenges<br>(provision of infrastructures, attracting investment, creating good<br>environment, etc)<br>2) the scale of these challenges vary from region to region, as well as do<br>policy responses, i.e. state-led development, market-led development<br>3) students should understand and be able to apply the fundamental<br>principles of: 1) urban planning and design (what sort of environment to be<br>created), 2) policy and governance (how to achieve it), and 3) be aware of<br>the [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-11T11:48:37+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Nadir Kinossian</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;79219894.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;aff86f2e.1503">   <title>Re: Session proposal: "teaching post-socialist urbanism(s)" (and a sort of open call to CAT members to participate) </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;aff86f2e.1503</link>   <description> Dear Oleg,<br>We have an ongoing Marie Curie project for training young researchers who (all) focus their PhD studies on socio-spatial polarization processes in East and Central Europe. (They all do comparative research.)<br>I can share the lessons we have so far at the round table. I do not plan any \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdformal\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd speech, just being involved and contributing... \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd.<br>Best,<br>Erika [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-11T07:28:16+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Nagy Erika</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;aff86f2e.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;7cd3e7be.1503">   <title>Session proposal: "teaching post-socialist urbanism(s)" (and a sort of open call to CAT members to participate) </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;7cd3e7be.1503</link>   <description> Dear CATferenceOrganizers, \ufffd\ufffdI am submittinga proposal of the session, which is not typical though. \ufffd\ufffdIt has aformat of \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdround table\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd and is devoted not to an essential research issues, but to another \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdformof academic activity\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd, so to say, namely \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd to education related to the CAT andits subject, "post-socialist urbanism". That is why I thought CATference isprobably a right place to have such a discussion. \ufffd\ufffdTheproposal is slightly incomplete yet ( always two more days are needed.., sorry for that) \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd I am still expecting confirmation from severalcolleagues who I asked to be speakers at a round table. I hope [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-10T22:02:50+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Oleg Pachenkov</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;7cd3e7be.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;d6c7522b.1503">   <title>New RSA research funding schemes announced </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;d6c7522b.1503</link>   <description> ***Apologies for cross-posting***<br>Regional Studies Association<br>announced new research funding schemes<br><br>Dear List members,<br><br>We are pleased to announce that as part of the Regional Studies Association&lt;http://www.regionalstudies.org/&gt;\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds 50th anniversary new funding schemes and increased funding for Research Networks have been agreed. By offering these, the Association is seeking to raise the profile of regional research and its contribution if appropriate, to policy and practice. Research awards will be judged on the basis of the excellence of the research proposal and the ability of the applicant to communicate the results of the research broadly. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-09T14:29:22+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Daniela Carl</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;d6c7522b.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;6877fc57.1503">   <title>cfp for a CATference session on post-socialist urban infrastructures </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;6877fc57.1503</link>   <description> Dear CATs,<br><br>There are still some spaces left to make the session a bit bigger. We can<br>accept abstracts for review until Monday (9 March) morning the latest.<br><br>Thank you for everyone who has already sent abstract! We compile the<br>session on Monday evening.<br><br>Best,<br><br>Tauri<br>Call for papers for a proposed session at the 6th CATference International<br>Urban Geographies of Post-communist States Conference: 25 years of urban<br>change [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-07T11:10:42+02:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Tauri Tuvikene</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;6877fc57.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;5e32d6f9.1503">   <title>Call for candidates to the Coordination Team of AESOP YA </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;5e32d6f9.1503</link>   <description> The AESOP Young Academics Network is looking for three new members for its<br>Coordination Team.<br>Please distribute to those potentially interested.<br><br>*It was an awesome time and unique opportunity from which I benefit in the<br>further course of my career.*<br><br>*Verena Peer,* *MODUL University Vienna*<br><br>The call for candidates to the *Coordination Team of the AESOP Young<br>Academics Network* is now open (deadline Abril 13, 2015). [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-06T09:19:43+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Craig Young</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;5e32d6f9.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;f3ed3522.1502">   <title>CATference session: The 'housing question' in post-socialist cities: policies, innovations and contestations </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;f3ed3522.1502</link>   <description> Dear Colleagues,<br><br>Given the extension of the deadline for the session proposals, we would like<br>to extend our call for the 6th CAT-ference (please see below). We look<br>forward to receiving more interesting abstracts.<br><br>Best wishes,<br><br>Anna Badyina and Carola Neugebauer<br><br>...    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-28T17:38:24-00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Anna Badyina</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;f3ed3522.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;4dd47b2a.1502">   <title>Second CATference CfP: Theorising urban transitions: urban spatialities in the making (and remaking) </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;4dd47b2a.1502</link>   <description> Dear Colleagues<br><br>There\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds still one or two presentation slots available to make two full sessions from this CfP (which otherwise already promises to be a very interesting collection). We therefore extend the deadline to the 5th of March.<br><br>Best wishes<br>Oleg Golubchikov and Lud\ufffd\ufffdk S\ufffd\ufffdkora   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-28T16:17:10+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Oleg Golubchikov</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;4dd47b2a.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;b0b6ad1f.1502">   <title>CATference session: Urban policies and non-policies in post-socialist cities </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;b0b6ad1f.1502</link>   <description> Dear cats and kittens,<br><br>We are pleased to invite You to submit Your abstract for the CATference session:&quot;Urban policies and non-policies in post-socialist cities&quot;<br><br>Session organizers: Kadri Leetmaa (University of Tartu, Estonia), Johanna Holvandus (University of Tartu, Estonia), Jasna Stefanovska (University Ss. Cyril and Methodius, Skopje, Macedonia); Discussants: Annegret Haase (Helmholtz Centre for Environmental Research \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd UFZ), Katrin Grossmann (Fachhochschule Erfurt) [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-27T16:57:19+02:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Kadri Leetmaa</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;b0b6ad1f.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;3a0d85bd.1502">   <title>event call </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;3a0d85bd.1502</link>   <description> Dear All,<br>The following call might be interesting or worth for forwarding...<br>Cheers,<br>Erika<br><br>Invitation: Fred Jevons Lecture 2015<br><br>Bankspeak: the Language of World Bank Reports, 1946-2012<br>Dominique Pestre<br><br>The 2015 Fred Jevons Lecture will be delivered by Dominique Pestre (Institute Francilien Recherche, Soci\ufffd\ufffdt\ufffd\ufffd and Centre Alexandre Koyr\ufffd\ufffd, EHESS, Paris) on Wednesday 11 March 2015 at 5.30pm at Manchester Business School East, Booth Street East, Manchester. The lecture will be followed by a drinks reception. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-27T10:12:16+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Nagy Erika</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;3a0d85bd.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;6d16af06.1502">   <title>cat facebook page </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;6d16af06.1502</link>   <description> Hi catference session organizers and others,<br>Thanks for your activity so far! Please remember to post your session<br>information on the CAT Facebook page as well! Also, if you forward<br>your call to Nat Trumbull he might post in the AAG fora, at his<br>discretion of course.<br>Cheers,<br>MiG   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-27T02:36:12+02:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Michael Gentile</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;6d16af06.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;1802875a.1502">   <title>CATference CFD: Post-political urban landscapes?! Where is the political in urban development and urban theory in Eastern Europe? </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;1802875a.1502</link>   <description> Dear Colleagues,<br>Please see below a call for a panel discussion proposal.<br><br>Best wishes,<br>Katrin Gro\ufffd\ufffdmann and Christian Smigiel<br><br>Smigiel, Christian; Gro\ufffd\ufffdmann, Katrin<br><br>Post-political urban landscapes?! Where is the political in urban<br>development and urban theory in Eastern Europe?<br><br>Panel discussion proposal for the 6th CATference, Prague, September<br>23-26th 2015<br><br>In the debate on post-politics, the post-political city is part of a<br>new phase in societal development characterized by politics of consensus<br>and a loss of the political moment. The capitalist organisation of<br>society is no longer questioned, governmental techniques priviledge<br>elites, experts assessments replace political debate, managerial and<br>technocratic [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-26T22:32:51+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Christian Smigiel</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;1802875a.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;c867264d.1502">   <title>CATference CFD: Post-political urban landscapes?! Where is the political in urban development and urban theory in Eastern Europe? </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;c867264d.1502</link>   <description> Dear Colleagues,<br>Please see below a call for a panel discussion proposal.<br><br>Best wishes,<br>Katrin Gro\ufffd\ufffdmann and Christian Smigiel<br><br>Smigiel, Christian; Gro\ufffd\ufffdmann, Katrin Post-political urban landscapes?! Where is the political in urban development and urban theory in Eastern Europe? Panel discussion proposal for the 6th CATference, Prague, September 23-26th 2015<br><br>In the debate on post-politics, the post-political city is part of a new phase in societal development characterized by politics of consensus and a loss of the political moment. The capitalist organisation of society is no longer questioned, governmental techniques priviledge elites, experts assessments replace political debate, managerial and technocratic [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-26T22:20:11+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Christian Smigiel</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;c867264d.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;3eb3d62b.1502">   <title>Re: CATference 2015 deadline </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;3eb3d62b.1502</link>   <description> Dear All,<br><br>in agreement with Katrin\ufffd\ufffds and others\ufffd\ufffd suggestions, the organization team<br>has decided to postpone the deadline for abstracts submission. Please note<br>that *the extended deadline is March 10*, allowing the CATference<br>scientific committee enough time to go through all received material and<br>get back to you with the letter of acceptance by the end of March. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-23T19:30:11+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>CAT2015</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;3eb3d62b.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;622858a3.1502">   <title>CAT-CfP: session on post-socialist urban infrastructures </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;622858a3.1502</link>   <description> Dear colleagues,<br><br>Tauri Tuvikene and myself would like to invite you to be part of the proposed session on Post-socialist urban infrastructures. For details see below.<br><br>All the best,<br><br>Wladimir<br><br>Call for papers for a proposed session at the 6th CATference<br>International Urban Geographies of Post-communist States Conference: 25 years of urban change<br>In Prague, Czech Republic on September 23-26th 2015 [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-23T12:57:39+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Sgibnev, Wladimir</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;622858a3.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;9c4a8040.1502">   <title>Re: CAT-ference session on Quantitative Urban Research </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;9c4a8040.1502</link>   <description> Hi Tiit,<br>once again thank you for your time in Tartu and for support for Ruta, of<br>course. I have already submitted our paper (*Socio-economic aspects of<br>ethnic segregation of major Lithuanian cities)*, which could fit to this<br>Session perfectly, but it wasn't proposed jet. I hope organizers will<br>notice this, or you will...:) It would be devoted to ethnic dimension of<br>segregation so we could start working on paper we've discussed in Tartu...<br>best,<br>Donatas [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-23T14:04:09+02:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Donatas Burneika</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;9c4a8040.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;a5625326.1502">   <title>CATference 2015: Session proposal "Small towns" </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;a5625326.1502</link>   <description> Dear colleagues and friends,<br><br>&quot;25 years of urban change&quot; were not restricted to the metropolises and<br>big cities. Therefore I am highly interested in (organizing) a session<br>on the fortunes of small towns in post-socialist countries (and<br>research, respectively).<br><br>If you are interested in this topic and giving a presentation in Prague<br>at the end of September 2015, please send an abstract to me by the end<br>of this week (28 February). I am sorry for the relatively short notice. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-23T09:59:29+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Annett Steinf\ufffd\ufffdhrer</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;a5625326.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;82dbf5d5.1502">   <title>Re: CATference 2015 deadline </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;82dbf5d5.1502</link>   <description> Dear CATference 2015 team,<br><br>after the recent exchanges on session<br>ideas, it seems that quite a number of ideas are still in the formation.<br>This is also the case for me and colleagues from Leipzig/ Erfurt, sorry<br>for being a little late here.<br><br>Would it be possible to extent the<br>deadline for abstracts and sessions, maybe for two weeks untill March,<br>15th so all the calls for sessions have some more &quot;air&quot; to be organized? [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-22T17:47:03+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Katrin Grossmann</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;82dbf5d5.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;43b69f9a.1502">   <title>CAT-ference session on Quantitative Urban Research </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;43b69f9a.1502</link>   <description> Dear all<br><br>Please find below a call for quantitative research based papers for the<br>upcoming CAT-ference in Prague.<br><br>Best wishes<br><br>Tiit, Martin, Szymon<br><br>CENSUS GEOGRAPHIES AND BEYOND:<br><br>NEW PATTERNS OF HOUSING SEGMENTATION, NEIGHBOURHOOD CHANGE AND<br>SEGREGATION<br><br>The aim of the session is to bring together quantitative research on<br>post-socialist cities, making use of the recently released data from the<br>2011 census round, as well as registers, surveys, mobile phone data etc.<br>We welcome theoretically informed, analytically rigorous and politically<br>relevant research based on solid empirical material that illustrates<br>varied forms of socio-spatial and socio-housing changes in<br>post-socialist cities. We encourage [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-22T13:20:58+02:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Tiit Tammaru</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;43b69f9a.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;818c77f1.1502">   <title>CATference 2015 scholarships </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;818c77f1.1502</link>   <description> Dear All,<br><br>Let us share some good news for participants from low income EU Association<br>Agreement countries (Ukraine, Moldova, Georgia), who may take part in the<br>CATference for free! There will be three scholarships available to those<br>attending from Ukraine, which is now commemorating the victims of the<br>Maidan massacre one year ago, one to those from the Republic of Moldova and<br>one to participants from Georgia. The scholarships are available on the<br>first come-first serve basis. The awardees will be notified by email after<br>acceptance of their abstract by the CATference scientific committee. The reformed housing was to<br>more effectively address the housing needs and achieve better living<br>standards for the populations. Furthermore, as the project was designed to make its results accessible to everyone, all three volumes are available for download as open access publication @ http://punctumbooks.com/category/titles/department-of-eagles/ [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-19T10:00:07+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Bickert, Matthias</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;727e5ff.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;53fb1643.1502">   <title>call for catference abstracts for session on urban Ukraine </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;53fb1643.1502</link>   <description> 6th International Urban Geographies of Post-Communist States conference<br>(CAT-ference), Prague 23-26 September 2015<br><br>Call for abstracts (and papers) for a session on:<br><br>URBAN UKRAINE: PIVOTAL CITIES ON THE GEOPOLITICAL FAULTLINE<br><br>Session organizers: Michael Gentile (University of Helsinki) and Kostyantyn<br>Mezentsev (Taras Shevchenko National University of Kyiv)<br><br>Session discussant: Olga Medvedkov (Wittenberg University)<br><br>Nearly 25 years after the dissolution of the USSR, Ukraine is at a pivotal<br>moment in its history. Do not miss the opportunity to participate in the<br>high-quality scholarship event which will be held at the Charles University<br>in Prague in September 2015.<br><br>Abstracts of your papers and sessions can be submitted by filling in<br>the registration<br>form<br>&lt;https://docs.google.com/a/natur.cuni.cz/forms/d/1sykDhVaGTy8r7lSnZwqX1S3CpLKgXMPen18FtuEZDig/viewform&gt;by<br>28 February. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-15T16:47:30+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>CAT2015</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;698b3b58.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;7ffca482.1502">   <title>Call for Contributors \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Dialogues of Sustainable Urbanisation</title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;7ffca482.1502</link>   <description> *From:* ISSC Secretariat [mailto:issc@worldsocialscience.org<br>&lt;issc@worldsocialscience.org&gt;]<br><br>Since 2013, the International Social Science Council (ISSC) has hosted two<br>seminars for early career researchers on the topic of sustainable<br>urbanisation<br>&lt;http://www.worldsocialscience.org/activities/world-social-science-fellows-programme/&gt;<br>and the transitions to living in urban contexts. There is a wealth of<br>diverse and important social science research being carried out within the<br>ISSC networks and beyond. This project aims to bring our work together<br>quickly in an accessible format to showcase the latest social science<br>research and thinking on sustainable urbanisation. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-12T07:55:06+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Craig Young</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;7ffca482.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;ec536a87.1502">   <title>RSA Annual Conference 2015 - Piacenza, Italy<br>Regional Studies Association Annual Conference 2015<br><br>* 24th - 27th May, 2015, Universit\ufffd\ufffd Cattolica del Sacro Cuore, Piacenza, Italy [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-05T12:41:50+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Daniela Carl</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;ec536a87.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;8b48932e.1502">   <title>VB: Call for Papers: Experiences of Soviet Afghan War Veterans </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;8b48932e.1502</link>   <description> Dear all,<br>Could maybe be of interest to some on the list, see below.<br>Best,<br>Thomas    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-03T23:57:18+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Thomas Bor\ufffd\ufffdn</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;8b48932e.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;f7ab1737.1502">   <title>EURA Transforming cities, transformative cities CFP, Sibiu </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;f7ab1737.1502</link>   <description> The European Urban Research Association (EURA) and the<br>Lucian Blaga University of Sibiu (Romania) cordially<br>invite you to the 2015 EURA Conference to be held in<br>Sibiu, Romania on 17-20 September 2015.<br><br>The theme of the conference \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Transforming cities,<br>transformative cities \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd reflects EURA\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds ongoing concern<br>with the need to re-examine the place which cities take in<br>the political, social and economic order of contemporary<br>societies. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-03T09:03:45+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Craig Young</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;f7ab1737.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;2f091d5e.1502">   <title>Fwd: 2 PhD fellowships Urban reconfiguration in post-Soviet space </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CITIESAFTERTRANSITION;2f091d5e.1502</link>   <description> Dear all,<br>Sorry for cross postings but this seems of interest to this list.<br>Best,<br>Thomas<br><br>-------- Forwarded Message --------<br>Subject: 2 PhD fellowships Urban reconfiguration in post-Soviet space<br>Date: Mon, 2 Feb 2015 13:31:11 +0000<br>From: Slepukhina, Irina &lt;I_Slepukhina@IFL-LEIPZIG.DE&gt;<br>Reply-To: Slepukhina, Irina &lt;I_Slepukhina@IFL-LEIPZIG.DE&gt;<br>To: POST-SOCIALIST-GEOGRAPHIES@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br><br>Dear Colleagues,<br><br>please find bellow a CfA.
